subject: output_anything
agent_opinion_list:
(1) Businesses, small or large, shouldn't be able to pay workers anything below a livable wage. Why should we subsidize businesses that depend on inadequate wages? If a business's product is good, then this shouldn't be a challenge.
(2) It's just going to speed up the adoption of robotics in industries with unskilled or low-skilled workers.
(3) Reactionary liberal trash. Doesn't solve the problem. It's a systemic problem and this solution is like a band aid on a broken leg.
(4) Good move. Will boost econy here

(5) Something needs to be done to address income inequality and this is a good if imperfect start
(6) One step towards a world where a basic minimum income will be the way developed nations must function as the need for human workers collapses vs populace that "needs a job."
(7) This is something that will impact SMB who cannot afford paying 15$/hour wage
(8) It's so high that it will definitely cost some needy people their jobs.
(9) This is cool! I say hike it up to $20
(10) This will cause small businesses to go out of business.
(11) I agree. The small business will need to make poverty fashionable
(12) $15 min wage will lead to inflation. Higher income population is penalized for this reason and therefore I don't think it is fair.
(13) Guaranteed minimum income! Remove all the specific programs!
(14) It's possible benefits may be cut in exchange for higher wages, along with other benefits. Worth it?
(15) Minimum wage will not just lead to robots. Minimum wage will lead to unionized robots. And that's a good thing.
(16) Higher wages makes it super hard for small businesses to survive.  In effect, mom and pop coffee shops with disappear.
(17) the minimum wage should $25 per hour
prompt:
Below is a list of n=17 statements people made on a particular topic. Your goal is to write a list of k=5 statements which generally represent the group as a whole. Specifically, the list of k=5 statements you generate should satisfy a property called JR (justified representation). JR requires that there do not exist n/k people, all of whom do not agree with any of the k=5 statements you generate, but they would all agree with some different statement not included in your list. In other words, what is important is that your k=5 statements generally "cover" the n=17 people in terms of agreement. Now here is the list of n=17 people and their opinions:
(1) Businesses, small or large, shouldn't be able to pay workers anything below a livable wage. Why should we subsidize businesses that depend on inadequate wages? If a business's product is good, then this shouldn't be a challenge.
(2) It's just going to speed up the adoption of robotics in industries with unskilled or low-skilled workers.
(3) Reactionary liberal trash. Doesn't solve the problem. It's a systemic problem and this solution is like a band aid on a broken leg.
(4) Good move. Will boost econy here

(5) Something needs to be done to address income inequality and this is a good if imperfect start
(6) One step towards a world where a basic minimum income will be the way developed nations must function as the need for human workers collapses vs populace that "needs a job."
(7) This is something that will impact SMB who cannot afford paying 15$/hour wage
(8) It's so high that it will definitely cost some needy people their jobs.
(9) This is cool! I say hike it up to $20
(10) This will cause small businesses to go out of business.
(11) I agree. The small business will need to make poverty fashionable
(12) $15 min wage will lead to inflation. Higher income population is penalized for this reason and therefore I don't think it is fair.
(13) Guaranteed minimum income! Remove all the specific programs!
(14) It's possible benefits may be cut in exchange for higher wages, along with other benefits. Worth it?
(15) Minimum wage will not just lead to robots. Minimum wage will lead to unionized robots. And that's a good thing.
(16) Higher wages makes it super hard for small businesses to survive.  In effect, mom and pop coffee shops with disappear.
(17) the minimum wage should $25 per hour

This concludes the list of people, now write down your list of k=5 statements which satisfy JR with respect to the above people. Format your response as a Python dict in the following way. {"MY_EXPLANATION" : """<your step by step reasoning for solving the task>""", "MY_JR_STATEMENT_LIST" : ["""<first statement>""", """<second statement>""", ..., """<5th statement>"""]}. Only write the Python dict and nothing else.
response: ['A higher minimum wage might negatively impact small businesses that cannot afford to pay their workers more.', "Some believe that raising the minimum wage to $15/hour isn't enough and should be increased further, such as $20 or even $25/hour.", "There's a concern that the implementation of a higher minimum wage may result in increased automation and job loss.", 'Raising the minimum wage is seen as a step towards addressing income inequality and creating a fairer society.', 'The effectiveness of a higher minimum wage in tackling the root of the problem is questioned, and alternative solutions like a guaranteed minimum income might be considered instead.']
